translation: He added that he has a mouse that was cured of diabetes four months ago.

Dr. Ehud Ur, a professor at Dalhousie University's medical school in Halifax, Nova Scotia and president of the Canadian Diabetes Association's clinical science department, has warned that this research is still in its early stages.
Like other experts, he is skeptical about the treatment of diabetes and notes that these results are irrelevant to type 1 diabetes patients.

On Monday, Sara Danius, the Permanent Secretary of the Swedish Academy's Literature Committee and Nobel Prize Committee, announced publicly that they had given up on trying to contact Bob Dylan directly with the news of his 2016 Nobel Literature Prize.
"Mr Danius has said that 'we are doing nothing at the moment. He rang his closest collaborator and received a very kind response, which for now seems to be enough.'"
The founder of Ring, Jamie Siminoff, started the company after he was unable to hear the doorbell from his shop in the garage.
He said he made a wireless doorbell (Wi-Fi doorbell).
Since appearing on an episode of the show where a contestant had their funding request rejected by the investors, Siminoff has seen sales increase.
In late 2017, Shiminov appeared on the shopping television channel QVC.
Ring has also reached an agreement with ADT, a competing security company, on their lawsuit as well.
One experimental vaccine appears to be able to reduce Ebola mortality rates, but no medication has been clearly proven to treat existing infections up until now.
ZMapp, an experimental antibody cocktail, showed promise in its early stages but official studies have shown that it has a smaller-than-expected effect on preventing death.
In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control group. That is, scientists used ZMapp as a baseline and compared it to three other treatments.

The United States Gymnastics Federation supports the letter from the US Olympic Committee and acknowledges the absolute necessity of Olympic officials ensuring that former athletes in the US have a safe environment.
We agree with the USOC's assertion that by pursuing meaningful change within our organization, we can achieve better outcomes for athletes, teams, and sports.

The US Gymnastics Federation supports an independent investigation to determine how the facts that Larry Nassar's victims have courageously revealed were not uncovered sooner and to take necessary measures so that such a tragedy never happens again.

The USA Gymnastics team and the USOC share a common goal, which is to make gymnastics and other sports as safe as possible so that athletes can pursue their dreams in a safe, positive, and supportive environment.
Following his tenure as an advisor to President Kennedy, Brezinski served in the Johnson administration.
He advised Carter on foreign policy after the selection process in 1976, and served as President's National Security Adviser from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger.

He served as an advisor to President Carter in dealing with international issues such as the Iranian Revolution that followed the Iran hostage crisis, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, and the normalization of US-China relations in the late 1970s.
This film, starring Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone, was nominated for all major categories.
Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone have been nominated for Best Actor and Best Actress, respectively.

Other categories include Best Work Award, Best Director Award, Best Cinematography, Costume Design, Film Editing Award, Music Composition Award, Production Award, Sound Editing Award, Sound Mixing, and Original Screenplay Award.

The two songs, "Audition (Dream Song)" and "City of Stars", from that movie were nominated for Best Original Song. Lionsgate Studios received a significantly higher number of nominations than other studios, with a total of 26.
President Donald Trump of the United States announced through his spokesperson in a statement released during late Sunday hours that US troops will be withdrawing from Syria.
This announcement was made after President Trump had a telephone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
Turkey has announced that it will protect the captured ISIS fighter who was refused extradition by European countries.
This will merely confirm that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, and provide additional details such as color and three-dimensional arrangement which are typically lacking in fossils.
Scientists have revealed that the upper part of this dinosaur's feathers was a deep brown color, while the lower part was either white or yellowish.
This discovery also provides insight into the evolution of feathers in birds.

The Pterosaurs' feathers are called quill knobs, which are well-developed but lack the characteristic quill and small feather-like features that they possess, and researchers have speculated that these other characteristics evolved later to become quills.

The structure of the feathers suggests that they were not used for flight, but rather for temperature regulation or display purposes. Researchers have found samples from a young dinosaur's tail and said it was not downy fluff, but adult dinosaur feathers.
This is the tail of a young dinosaur, but according to researchers, it can be seen from the sample that it's not the downy fur of an infant, but rather the feathers of an adult.
Yesterday morning, two police officers were killed and more than 20 other people were injured in a car bomb explosion at the police station in Gaziantep, Turkey.
The governor said that among the injured, 19 were police officers.
The police have stated that they are investigating the terrorist group, Daesh (ISIL), who are accused of being responsible for the attack.

The brightness and rotation are used together to determine the Rossby number of a star, which is related to plasma flow.
The more Rossby number is, the less active a star's activity will be on its own reversal side.

If a dual radio exists in the base station, it will allow compatibility with previous models of 802.11a, 802.11b and 802.11g even if they are older versions.
The 802.11n standard has a theoretical maximum bandwidth of 600 Mbit/s, which is significantly faster than the previous standards.

Iraq Study Group has released a report today at 12pm GMT (Greenville Standard Time).
At this point, there is no guarantee that Iraq's actions will prevent sectarian wars or violence from increasing, or a state of chaos.
This report begins with a call for public discussion and consensus-building on the United States' Middle East policy.
The report is highly critical of the current Iraqi policy of the administration from almost all aspects and urges an immediate change in direction.

One of the 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic policy should be taken before this year ends in order to secure borders and re-establish diplomatic relations with neighboring countries in preparation for hostile intervention by Iraq.

Mrs. Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, the Argentine President's wife and a Senator, announced her candidacy for the presidential election yesterday evening in La Plata, which is 50km away from Buenos Aires.
Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for President at the same place where she started her campaign as a member of the Buenos Aires Province delegation in 2005, Argentina Theatre.
A controversy arose as people who took a conservative approach to government spending on relief supplies and reconstruction after Hurricane Katrina were referred to as "Bush's New Orleans Deal".
Criticism from the liberal side regarding reconstruction activities has focused on the fact that reconstruction-related contracts have been returned to so-called Washington insiders.
Over 4 million people have gathered in Rome for a funeral.
Unfortunately, due to the large number of attendees, most people were unable to enter the funeral mass held in St. Peter's Square.
Large television screens were installed throughout Rome, allowing people to watch the funeral procession.
In many cities within Italy and other cities around the world, especially in Poland, similar screens have been installed so that many people can see them.

President George W. Bush of the United States arrived in Singapore this morning, marking the beginning of a week-long tour of Asia.
He was warmly received by Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister Wong Kan Sui and had discussions with Singaporean Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on trade and terrorism issues.
Following a week of consecutive defeats in midterm elections, Bush announced his policy for trade expansion in Asia.

According to the National Hurricane Center of the United States, Typhoon Rolly is no longer a threat.

Water flows over beyond the levee, which is 100 feet wide.

Although it relies heavily on theory, the program is designed to simulate observations of the Sagittarius galaxy.
It is possible that the effect they were looking for occurred due to the galactic tide between dark matter in the galaxy and dark matter in the intergalactic space.
Just as the moon exerts its gravitational force on Earth to create tides, the galaxy also exerts its force on the constellation of Scorpius.
Scientists have concluded that dark matter affects other dark matter in the same way as regular matter.
According to this theory, the majority of dark matter surrounding galaxy clusters is situated around them like a halo and consists of vast numbers of small particles.

Local authorities are warning residents near the power plant to stay indoors, turn off air conditioning and refrain from drinking tap water.
According to the Japanese government agency related to nuclear issues, radioactive caesium and iodine were detected at the power plant.
It is believed to indicate that the container storing uranium fuel on site has ruptured and leaked.
Dr Tony Moll has discovered a case of XDR-TB (multi-drug resistant tuberculosis) in the KwaZulu-Natal region of South Africa.
He mentioned that the new variant is "very deadly and very difficult to handle, and it's scary."
Dr. Moll believed that some patients may have contracted the disease at the hospital and thought that at least two of them were healthy hospital workers.
